org.eclipse.keyple.example.common.calypso

Class Demo_CalypsoBasicTransactionEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.keyple.example.common.calypso.Demo_CalypsoBasicTransactionEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.event.ObservableReader.ReaderObserver, org.eclipse.keyple.util.Observable.Observer<org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.event.ReaderEvent>

    public class Demo_CalypsoBasicTransactionEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.event.ObservableReader.ReaderObserver
    This Calypso demonstration code consists in:
    1. Setting up a two-reader configuration and adding an observer method (update)
    2. Starting a card operation when a PO presence is notified (operatePoTransactions)
    3. Opening a logical channel with the CSM (C1 CSM is expected) see (CSM_C1_ATR_REGEX)
    4. Attempting to open a logical channel with the PO with 3 options:
      • Selection with a fake AID
      • Selection with a Navigo AID
      • Selection with a Hoplink AID
    5. Display SeRequest/SeResponse data (printSelectAppResponseStatus)
    6. If the Calypso selection succeeded, do a Calypso transaction ({doCalypsoReadWriteTransaction(PoSecureSession, ApduResponse, boolean)} doCalypsoReadWriteTransaction}).

    The Calypso transactions demonstrated here shows the Keyple API in use with Calypso SE (PO and CSM).

    Read the doc of each methods for further details.

      • doCalypsoReadWriteTransaction

        public void doCalypsoReadWriteTransaction(org.eclipse.keyple.calypso.transaction.PoSecureSession poTransaction,
                                          boolean closeSeChannel)
                                   throws org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.KeypleReaderException
        Do an Calypso transaction:
        • Process opening
        • Process PO commands
        • Process closing

        File with SFI 1A is read on session opening.

        T2 Environment and T2 Usage are read in session.

        The PO logical channel is kept open or closed according to the closeSeChannel flag

        Parameters:
        poTransaction - PoSecureSession object
        closeSeChannel - flag to ask or not the channel closing at the end of the transaction
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.KeypleReaderException - reader exception (defined as public for purposes of javadoc)

      • operatePoTransactions

        public void operatePoTransactions()
        Do the PO selection and possibly go on with Calypso transactions.
